result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Jean Spruell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served in the amount of 99 days as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department
Granted Good time 
Granted Work release
Concurrent with: 17CM185

Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
  All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.

miscConds.notes: All financial obligations are placed on payment plan of $25 beginning 7/2/2018

Comply with and follow all treatment recommendations by the current therapist. 
Follow  other treatment recommendations as directed by the DOC. Contact New Horizons North for information on services.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any  mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Defendant is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold  there.
  The defendant is ordered to random drug testing.
Provide the agent with a list of medications as prescribed. 
NO ABUSIVE contact with Matthew Spruell. 
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen at the Ashland County Jail within 7 days.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

Defendant Melissa Jean Spruell in court with attorney Kevin Michael Schram.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM164, 16CM223, 17CM185-- Prepared to proceed with a PLEAS--  Agreement of parties as in the offer to settle. Understands charges and potential penalties. PLEADS NC to the 2 counts. Admits she is a repeater and act of domestic abuse. 16CM223 and 17CM185 Count 1 are DRI and uncharged read-ins. Signed PQ. Took pres as pres. Understand elements of crimes. Wants Ct to accept pleas of NC. Ct accepts pleas and finds G. State complied with vic rights. comments on prior record. Atty comments- ASking Court to follow the agreement. Mental health was a problem.  Ct comments on sentencing. Both are imposed and stayed sentence. 
Ct orders-- See offer to settle.
Gentleman came to window, stating phone # was not for defendant, please stop calling.  (I removed phone number from case)
Clerk called Atty. Atty was given court date and time.

STC might turn into Plea and Sentencing Hearing  Status conference scheduled for June 11, 2018 at 04:00 pm.

Attorney Kevin Michael Schram in court for Defendant Melissa Jean Spruell. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Melissa Jean Spruell appeared by phone means from Winnebago. Ct calls Dr. Heaslett. States motion to have medications admistered. Atty Schram no agreement, client opposes request. State calls Dr. Heaslett. Ct swears witness in, exam, state asks that the letter from Feb (dr. Heaslett's letter) be admitted-admitted. 4:27p Cross. State rests. Def does not want to testify. Atty Schram offers exhibits 1 and 2 (photos) Admitted. 4:36p State closes, Defense closes. 
4:43 Ct rules Not competent to refuse medication, Grants request to order medication, administer as neccessary even involuntary.

Defendant Melissa Jean Spruell in court with attorney Kevin Michael Schram.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 3 cases. Issue of competency raised, Ct hopeful that outpatient treatment would be successful, Ct reviews letter from treatment facility. ADA would support the request. Atty Schram, comments on contact information, has not had contact with def since last hearing. Def comments best way to contact her is through the mail. Ct grants request for warrant, def to be treated in an inpatient facility. Def advised that she will be taken into custody and taken to a hospital. Def states she will have treatment starting on Friday through the VA. Atty Schram comments will be retiring. Def comments.

Defendant Melissa Jean Spruell in court with attorney Kevin Michael Schram.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM164,223, 17CM185. States position is that def is not competent. Def position is that she is extremely competent. State calls Dr Seifer, Ct calls Dr by telephone, sworn exam, call cut off. Ct tried to call number left message for Dr to call back, tried calling again no answer(vmail). Ct finds that the state has not provided evidence to overcome competency issue. 10:11am Dr called in, ct will reconsider the finding that def is competent, ct vacates previous finding. Exam continues. Call dropped, Dr called back, back on record, exam continues, State presents Dr Report as exhibit. Exhibit 1 marked and Admitted.
Atty Schram cross. Redirect. State rests, 5 min recess. Back on record, Def does not want to testify. State's argument, incompetent at this time but may be restored to competency, medical treatment suspend proceedings commit to health services not to exceed 12 mo. 
Atty Scharm argument can identify some parts of process ask to find her competent. Ct comments, finds by clear and convincing evidence not competent, committed to DHS, proceeding suspended, compentence may be restored in 12 mo. Does not order mode of treatment, not ordered to invol. medication. Def keep in contact with atty, no hearing scheduled at this time, Health services report that she is compentent will set hearing.  Internal review scheduled for May 9, 2018 at 08:00 am.
Def called asking when her court hearing was scheduled for, advised def hearing is today (11/9/17) @ 10:00am
Competency hearing on November 9, 2017 at 10:00 am.
To Ct from DA regarding rescheduling

Defendant Melissa Jean Spruell in court with attorney Kevin Michael Schram.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM164,223 and 17CM185. Atty Schram rec report, client believes she is completent. State believes she is not competent. Today's hearing is not a competency hearing  it is a status conference. 17CM185 criminal complaint filed today, Def has recieved copy of complaint. Ct finds prob cause, reason to doubt competency, determination will be as to all three cases. Def does not have phone, address is same.  Competency hearing scheduled for October 31, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Melissa Jean Spruell in court with attorney Kevin Michael Schram.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2 cases. Ct comments on hearing for competency. Def comments. Def wants a second evaluation done but cannot due it without her husbands influance, Atty Schram comments can be given 2nd eval through pub def, wishes to speak to def, back on record, wants second opinion for competency Atty Schram will apply to the pub def office for funding. Def does want second evaluation, wants input. Ct orders second eval, will give atty time to apply for funding through the pub def. If unable to get funding can ask the court, state doesnt object to defense suggesting who they want assigned.  Status conference scheduled for September 25, 2017 at 01:45 pm.
Back on record, def objects to signing bond but will sign it against her will. Def does sign the bond.

164, 165cm223  AIA - Defendant Melissa Jean Spruell in court.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wanted an attorney, applied at SPD and she has been rejected and wants more time to find an attorney.  Wants to resc to beg of the year - needs to find own place to live and get a job and start working and wants court to review rejection.  Rejection based on spouses income.  Court asks her to send a letter stating the request in writing and then schedule a hearing coordinating with State, SPD and Def and would like to have done before the end of the year.  File that within next 10 days.  If no response then court assumes she changed her mind.  Try to get that hearing in yet this year hearing to review rejection.  Jan 9the hearing is the AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 9, 2017 at 10:30 am.
